Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I see twitter "experts" saying re-orgs are evil, like good little sheep

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: well- microforks of max 3 blocks  you mean?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @LocoMB actually, what to you mean?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is no "3 block microfork rule", those are made up words

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: 'chain re-org ... are a core part of the protocol necessary for normal operation'

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Yes, what I said.

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: I didn't mean rule - just that re-orgs happen all the time, with just a few blocks

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Correct

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: with six block reorg being a liiiitle bit onthe high side for a healthy blockchain, as happened with VBK the other day üò∫ .. oh wait, or was it BSV?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes. with big enough bribes to get majority hashrate mining the fork (before the stolen funds transferred), and sustained for a long enough time it could work, but would need to be started almost immediately after the theft. so unless the entire thing was fully orchestrated, there is no practical way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for chains that are not the majority hashrate for an algo, reorgs of hundreds of blocks is not any problem

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: * failry sure BSV had a six block reorg- because nodes started choking on those 128MB blocks

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Also agree with jl777

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: BSV issues are not hashrate, but block propagation

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Doing a massive chain re-org *is* possible, but requires massive coordination immediately, the time is already past

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It's technically possible

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and LEGAL according to Satoshi's Vision, i.e. Bitcoin Protocol

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Every person saying it's "wrong" is wrong

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It's technically valid

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: That is all we have.

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: Re-orgs are nothing bad if they happen for technical reasons... but a human made reorg to erase a transaction is worse than a 51% attack

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This is a 51% attack, yes.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if they can bribe the miners with enough funds, it is part of the protocol

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am not arguing it's a great precedent, I am arguing that it is not "morally wrong" or whatever

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: Especially when it is to cover a rather not so bad loss fpr the hottest exchange in town

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: We are just following the protocol

Content: whether its cool or no, is not the point. it is just possible

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: Yes. Possible doesnt mean it will make a bad precedent

Content: so CZ's "we got a few days" is not right?

Content: Nah, the reorg wont happen at this point

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i would say a few blocks, a few hours at most, and that assumes you can get super majority of hashrate mining back from before the theft

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the miners are taking a big risk of not being able to catch up and mining for nothing

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Alright

Author: jl777c#5810

Content: i think the issue right now is that using these decentralized alternatives, both from a GUI perspective and technical perspective, is a bit confusing and difficult for most people
